meanings.definition: A person who enters a place without permission.
meanings.sent1: The intruders sneaked into the house through the back door.
meanings.sent2: The security cameras caught the intruders breaking into the building.
meanings.sent3: The intruders thought they could outsmart the alarm system, but they were wrong.
meanings.sent4: The idea of intruders invading her home filled her with fear.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors quickly called the police when they spotted the intruders.

meanings.definition: An unauthorized person who interferes with privacy or security.
meanings.sent1: The company hired security guards to prevent intruders from accessing sensitive information.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner installed a new alarm system to deter intruders from entering the property.
meanings.sent3: The intruders accidentally set off the motion sensor and triggered the alarm.
meanings.sent4: The concept of intruders lurking in the shadows gave her chills.
meanings.sent5: The sign on the gate warned potential intruders to stay away.

meanings.definition: A foreign body or organism that enters a living organism.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained how the intruders in his body were causing the illness.
meanings.sent2: The immune system works to fight off any harmful intruders that enter the body.
meanings.sent3: The intruders inside the plant were affecting its growth and health.
meanings.sent4: The idea of tiny intruders invading his body made him shudder.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied how the immune system recognizes and eliminates intruders.
